page.title: 08KILDRUMMY CASTLE GARDENS
page.content: Close to the castle ruins, in the grounds of the new castle,(now run as a hotel)there are beautiful gardens.In 1904 the owner decided to lay out a garden in and near the quarry, in the Back Den of Kildrummy. A japanese firm constructed the water garden, and a yorkshire firm constructed and planted the beds against the quarry face. Work on the garden is still continuing. One of the main features is a bridge which is a replica of the famous 13th cent Big O' Balgownie. In 1968 a Charitable trust was formed to run the gardens. The present Hon. Director of the trust lives nearby. The gardens, open between April and September, draw many visiters, both horticulturalists and families enjoying a visit to the coutryside. There are special open days twice a year in aid of charities.
